channel.title: Ramblings About Data
channel.description: Recent content on Ramblings About Data

item.title: Importance of Scheduling for Fantasty Football
item.description: Motivation I work with almost exclusively other economists, so you can imagine our ability to try and quantify the tiniest of things – especially in the realm of fantasy football. One topic that commonly comes up for us when discussing our work league is the extent that some teams get “unlucky” by continually having their weekly matchup against teams that play abnormally well against only you.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, my name is Stephen York and this is my personal site where I discuss my thoughts data science, economics, and other topics that are on my mind. To give you some background about myself, I graduated from The George Washington University with a B.A. in International Affairs and Economics. After graduating, I started working at my current job - an Economist at the Bureau of Labor Statistics. I am also a part-time graduate student earning my M.
